item.title: uv format: Code Formatting Comes to uv (experimentally!)
item.description: The latest uv release (0.8.13) quietly introduced an experimental new command that Python developers have been waiting for: uv format. This addition brings code formatting directly into uvâ€™s toolkit, eliminating the need to juggle multiple tools for basic Python development workflows. What is uv format? The uv format command provides Python code formatting through uvâ€™s interface. Under the hood, it calls Ruffâ€™s formatter to automatically style your code according to consistent standards.

item.title: Local Live Captioning with Whisper.cpp and FFmpeg
Why do software developers love complexity?
item.description: The Great Pyramids took decades to build. It was a monumental feat of human ingenuity and collaboration. Today, we software developers erect our own pyramids each day - not from stone, but from code. Yet despite far more advanced tools, these systems donâ€™t always make the experience better. So why, when KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) is a well-known mantra, do we keep gravitating toward complexity?

item.title: Weaponizing image scaling against production AI systems
item.description: In this blog post, weâ€™ll detail how attackers can exploit image scaling on Gemini CLI, Vertex AI Studio, Geminiâ€™s web and API interfaces, Google Assistant, Genspark, and other production AI systems. Weâ€™ll also explain how to mitigate and defend against these attacks, and weâ€™ll introduce Anamorpher, our open-source tool that lets you explore and generate these crafted images.
